metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0553 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An elevation of privilege vulnerability in libnl could enable a local malicious application to execute arbitrary code within the context of the Wi-Fi service. This issue is rated as Moderate because it first requires compromising a privileged process and is mitigated by current platform configurations. Product: Android. Versions: 5.0.2, 5.1.1, 6.0, 6.0.1, 7.0, 7.1.1. Android ID: A-32342065. NOTE: this issue also exists in the upstream libnl before 3.3.0 library.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnl-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-cli-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-genl-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-idiag-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-nf-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-route-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-utils - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libnl-xfrm-3-200 - 3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> I'm not sure this fix is strictly a security fix; the checkin comment gives me the impression callers are completely trusted.

criterions.comment: libnl3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.27-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
